column3: ACK otherwise, `NON_FATAL` was always a temporary hack it's good to see it gone.

- Do we want to print `stderr` to `stderr` maybe? (in this case, why `PIPE` it at all)\n- I'm not sure `Error opening file` is a good error message here. Might want to print the command that failed with the exit status.\n- Launching a command and raising an error on non-zero exit status what `subprocess.check_call` does. This might be good enough instead of defining our own function.
